lines.text: Where is the Scottish Border?.
In bed with the landlady!
[there is an anguished cry from behind the wall]

[walking towards the wall]
It came from behind this new painting.
How do you know it's a new painting?

[showing Eric the red 'paint']
The paint's still wet.
You're so smart.

[stops and looks Ernie in the eye]
How could you say that? You met my first partner, didn't you?

[tapping Eric on the shoulder]
I thought you didn't fool around with women?
No, what I said was, when it comes to women, I don't fool around!
How many clothing coupons did that cost?

[trying not to laugh at Eric's wig]
No, it's Zelda's, she let me have it.
I wish she'd let me have it!
[Milton decides to step outside for a breath of fresh air]
Be careful, remember what the guard said, there's a lunatic out there.

[looking at Eric and Ernie]
There's two in here. I'll take my chances!
How do I look?
He He, were there any other survivors?
Can anyone here play?
I can.
We realise that, but I was talking about the piano!
[Milton whispers something to Eric, then Ernie whispers something else to Eric]

[to Milton]
Say that again!
[Milton repeats his remark, while Ernie plays a short tune on the piano]

[to Ernie]
You're right, it does sound better to music!
[as they leave, Eric points to the novel in Ernie's hand]
How does it end? It's been right so far!
Well, it's completely wrong now - it says the villain gets away scot free!
[hands book to Eric]
[the novel reveals that the villian gets away]
I don't know why you waste your money!
[throws the book away]
Come on!

[nodding towards Rivers]
I'd like to have met him when he was alive!
It's said that Bonnie Prince Charlie slept in that bed.
By the look of it, so did his horse!
That Zelda, did she ever kiss you?
No, but she steamed my glasses up a couple of times!

[Indicating a shaken Kathy]
What have you been up to with her?
It's more a case of what she's ben up to with him!
[Indicates Uncle Felix's corpse, which is hanging from a coat hook on the wall]

[after Zelda laughs at Eric's wig]
you mustn't laugh
[points to Kathy's dress]
that's a very pretty dress!
